definition: A disorder characterized by a reduction in the amount of hemoglobin in 100 ml of blood. Signs and symptoms of anemia may include pallor of the skin and mucous membranes, shortness of breath, palpitations of the heart, soft systolic murmurs, lethargy, and fatigability.

grades.1: Hemoglobin (Hgb) <LLN - 10.0 g/dL; <LLN - 6.2 mmol/L; <LLN - 100 g/L
grades.3: Hgb <8.0 g/dL; <4.9 mmol/L; <80 g/L; transfusion indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by the inability of the bone marrow to make enough new blood cells.
notes: Do not report individual cell count decreases in addition to this term.

grades.2: Use of growth factor indicated; transfusion indicated
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated

term: Blood and lymphatic system disorders - Other, specify

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by the inability of the bone marrow to produce hematopoietic elements.
notes: Consider Blood and lymphatic system disorders: Anemia, Thrombocytopenia, and/or Investigations: Neutrophil count decreased if bone marrow hypocellularity is not seen.

grades.1: Mildly hypocellular or <=25% reduction from normal cellularity for age
grades.2: Moderately hypocellular or >25 - <50% reduction from normal cellularity for age
grades.3: Severely hypocellular or >50 - <=75% reduction cellularity from normal for age
grades.4: Aplastic persistent for longer than 2 weeks

definition: A disorder characterized by systemic pathological activation of blood clotting mechanisms which results in clot formation throughout the body. There is an increase in the risk of hemorrhage as the body is depleted of platelets and coagulation factors.

grades.2: Laboratory findings with no bleeding
grades.3: Laboratory findings and bleeding

definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate an increased number of eosinophils in the blood.

grades.1: >ULN and >Baseline
grades.3: Steroids initiated

definition: A disorder characterized by an ANC <1000/mm3 and a single temperature of >38.3 degrees C (101 degrees F) or a sustained temperature of >=38 degrees C (100.4 degrees F) for more than one hour.

grades.3: ANC <1000/mm3 with a single temperature of >38.3 degrees C (101 degrees F) or a sustained temperature of >=38 degrees C (100.4 degrees F) for more than one hour

definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate widespread erythrocyte cell membrane destruction.

grades.1: Laboratory evidence of hemolysis only (e.g., direct antiglobulin test; DAT; Coombs'; schistocytes; decreased haptoglobin)
grades.2: Evidence of hemolysis and >=2 g decrease in hemoglobin
grades.3: Transfusion or medical intervention indicated (e.g., steroids)

definition: Anemia resulting from hemolysis.

grades.1: <10% drop in Hgb from last assessment; intervention not indicated
grades.2: <=2 units of PRBCs transfused per day
grades.3: >2 units of PRBCs per day indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a form of thrombotic microangiopathy with renal failure, hemolytic anemia, and severe thrombocytopenia when the etiology is due to infections with shiga-toxin producing bacteria, such as E coli O157:H7.

grades.3: Laboratory findings with clinical consequences (e.g., renal insufficiency, petechiae)
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences, (e.g., CNS hemorrhage or thrombosis/embolism or renal failure)

definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate an increased number of white blood cells in the blood.
notes: Do not use for increases due to growth factors, steroids, or leukemias.

grades.4: Clinical manifestations of leucostasis; urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in a lymph node.
notes: Record final diagnosis/cause once determined.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A finding based on laboratory test results that indicate a decrease in number of lymphocytes in a blood specimen.

grades.1: Present

definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate increased methemoglobin in the blood.

grades.2: >ULN
grades.3: Requiring urgent intervention

definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in number of platelets in a blood specimen.

grades.3: <50,000 - 10,000/mm3; <50.0 - 10.0 x 10^9/L; transfusion indicated
grades.4: <10,000/mm3; 10.0 x 10^9/L; life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated

definition: A finding based on laboratory test results that indicate an increase in number of platelets in a blood specimen.

grades.1: Present

definition: A disorder characterized by a form of thrombotic microangiopathy with laboratory findings that indicate hemolytic anemia, severe thrombocytopenia, and renal insufficiency/failure.

grades.2: Outpatient intervention indicated (e.g., modification of immunosuppression)
grades.3: Transfusion or IV intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a deficiency of ADAMTS13 and the presence of microangiopathic hemolytic anemia, thrombocytopenic purpura, fever, renal abnormalities and neurological abnormalities such as seizures, hemiplegia, and visual disturbances. It is an acute or subacute condition.

grades.3: Laboratory findings with clinical consequences (e.g., renal insufficiency, petechiae)
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences, (e.g., CNS hemorrhage or thrombosis/embolism or renal failure)

definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in aortic valve function or structure.

grades.1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
grades.2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
grades.3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis by imaging; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia without cardiac electrical activity. Typically, this is accompanied by cessation of the pumping function of the heart.

grades.3: Intervention indicated; device (e.g., pacemaker)

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia without discernible P waves and an irregular ventricular response due to multiple reentry circuits. The rhythm disturbance originates above the ventricles.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated; electrical cardioversion
grades.3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated; device (e.g., pacemaker); ablation; new onset

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with organized rhythmic atrial contractions with a rate of 200-300 beats per minute. The rhythm disturbance originates in the atria.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated; device (e.g., pacemaker); ablation

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with complete failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction through the AV node to the ventricles.

grades.2: Non-urgent intervention indicated
grades.3: Symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or controlled with device (e.g., pacemaker); new onset

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a delay in the time required for the conduction of an electrical impulse through the atrioventricular (AV) node beyond 0.2 seconds; prolongation of the PR interval greater than 200 milliseconds.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Non-urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by cessation of the pumping function of the heart.

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by substernal discomfort due to insufficient myocardial oxygenation e.g., angina pectoris.
notes: Consider Cardiac disorders: Myocardial infarction. Record final diagnosis/cause once determined.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; pain on exertion; hemodynamically stable; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Pain at rest; cardiac catheterization; new onset cardiac chest pain; unstable angina; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by the inability of the heart to pump blood at an adequate volume to meet tissue metabolic requirements, or, the ability to do so only at an elevation in the filling pressure.
notes: If asymptomatic, consider Cardiac disorders: Left ventricular dysfunction.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; no initiation or intensification of treatment
grades.2: Outpatient initiation or intensification of treatment
grades.3: Hospitalization indicated
grades.4: Requiring inotropic support, mechanical circulatory support, or consideration of cardiac transplantation

definition: A disorder characterized by an ASYMPTOMATIC abnormality of cardiac function.
notes: If symptomatic, consider Cardiac disorders: Heart failure.

grades.1:
Left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) ≥50% AND one or more of the following:
1) New relative decline in Global Longitudinal Strain (GLS) >15% from baseline
2) New rise in cardiac biomarkers
grades.2:
LVEF 40 - 49% AND one or more of the following:
1) LVEF reduction by ≥10%
2) New relative decline in GLS >15% from baseline
3) New rise in cardiac biomarkers
grades.3: New LVEF reduction to <40%

definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in mitral valve function or structure.

grades.1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
grades.2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
grades.3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis by imaging; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with relatively constant PR interval prior to the block of an atrial impulse. This is the result of intermittent failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction through the atrioventricular (AV) node to the ventricles.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or require a device (e.g., pacemaker)

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a progressively lengthening PR interval prior to the blocking of an atrial impulse. This is the result of intermittent failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction through the atrioventricular (AV) node to the ventricles.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or controlled with device (e.g., pacemaker)

definition: A disorder characterized by gross necrosis of the myocardium; this is due to an interruption of blood supply to the area.

grades.2: Asymptomatic; imaging or ECG features consistent with myocardial infarction which may be of uncertain age

definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation of the muscle tissue of the heart.

grades.1: Asymptomatic with Lab or ECG findings only
grades.2: Symptoms with moderate activity or exertion
grades.3: Severe with symptoms at rest or with minimal activity or exertion; intervention indicated; new onset of symptoms
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., continuous IV therapy or mechanical hemodynamic support); hemodynamically unstable requiring non-invasive or invasive ventilation; complete or high grade AV block; significant ventricular arrhythmia

definition: A disorder characterized by an unpleasant sensation of irregular and/or forceful beating of the heart.
notes: Record final diagnosis/cause once determined.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with abrupt onset and sudden termination of atrial contractions with a rate of 150-250 beats per minute. The rhythm disturbance originates in the atria.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated; ablation
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; incompletely controlled medically; cardioversion indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by fluid collection within the pericardial sac, usually due to inflammation.
notes: Consider Cardiac disorders: Pericardial tamponade, Pericarditis.

grades.2: Asymptomatic effusion size small to moderate
grades.3: Effusion with physiologic consequences

definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in intrapericardial pressure due to the collection of blood or fluid in the pericardium.
notes: Consider Cardiac disorders: Pericarditis.

definition: A disorder characterized by irritation to the layers of the pericardium (the protective sac around the heart).

grades.1: Asymptomatic, ECG or physical findings (e.g., rub) consistent with pericarditis
grades.2: Symptomatic pericarditis (e.g., chest pain)
grades.3: Pericarditis with physiologic consequences (e.g., pericardial constriction)

definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in pulmonary valve function or structure.

grades.1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
grades.2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
grades.3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis by imaging; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with alternating periods of bradycardia and atrial tachycardia accompanied by syncope, fatigue and dizziness.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic, intervention not indicated; change in medication initiated
grades.3: Symptomatic, intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate less than 60 beats per minute that originates in the sinus node.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic, intervention not indicated; change in medication initiated
grades.3: Symptomatic, intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate greater than 100 beats per minute that originates in the sinus node.
notes: Record final diagnosis/cause once determined.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; non-urgent medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Urgent medical intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate greater than 100 beats per minute that originates above the ventricles.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in tricuspid valve function or structure.

grades.1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis
grades.2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
grades.3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia that originates in the ventricles.

grades.1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
grades.2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia without discernible QRS complexes due to rapid repetitive excitation of myocardial fibers without coordinated contraction of the ventricles.
A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate greater than 100 beats per minute that originates distal to the bundle of His.

grades.2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated

term: Congenital, familial and genetic disorders - Other, specify

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

term: Ear and labyrinth disorders - Other, specify

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the ear.
notes: Record final diagnosis/cause once determined.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the external ear region.
notes: Record final diagnosis/cause once determined.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by partial or complete loss of the ability to detect or understand sounds resulting from damage to ear structures.

grades.1:
Adult: Subjective change in hearing in the absence of documented hearing loss; threshold shift of 15 - 25 dB averaged at 2 contiguous test frequencies in at least one ear (on a 1, 2, 4, 3, 6, and 8 kHz audiogram); 
Pediatric (on a 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 kHz audiogram): Threshold shift >20 dB hearing loss (HL) (i.e., 25 dB HL or greater); sensorineural hearing loss (SNHL) above 4 kHz (i.e., 6 or 8 kHz) in at least one ear
grades.2:
Adult: Hearing loss not requiring hearing aid; intervention not indicated; limiting instrumental ADL; threshold shift of >25 dB averaged at 2 contiguous test frequencies in at least one ear (on a 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 kHz audiogram); 
Pediatric (on a 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 kHz audiogram): Threshold shift >20 dB at 4 kHz in at least one ear; mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity
grades.3:
Adult: Hearing loss requiring hearing aid; intervention indicated; limiting self-care ADL; threshold shift of >25 dB averaged at 3 contiguous test frequencies in at least one ear(on a 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 kHz audiogram); 
Pediatric (on a 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 kHz audiogram): Hearing loss sufficient to indicate therapeutic intervention, including hearing aids; threshold shift >20 dB at 2 to <4 kHz in at least one ear; severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity
grades.4:
Adult: Nonservicable hearing; decrease in hearing to profound bilateral loss (absolute threshold >80 dB HL at 2 kHz and above); 
Pediatric: Audiologic indication for cochlear implant; >40 dB HL (i.e., 45 dB HL or more); SNHL at 2 kHz and above

definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation (physiologic response to irritation), swelling and redness to the middle ear.

grades.1: Serous otitis
grades.2: Serous otitis, medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Mastoiditis; necrosis of canal soft tissue or bone

definition: A disorder characterized by noise in the ears, such as ringing, buzzing, roaring or clicking.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe symptoms; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation as if the external world were revolving around the patient (objective vertigo) or as if he himself were revolving in space (subjective vertigo).

grades.1: Mild symptoms
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe symptoms; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by dizziness, imbalance, nausea, and vision problems.

grades.2: Symptomatic; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe symptoms; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by the adrenal cortex not producing enough of the hormone cortisol and in some cases, the hormone aldosterone. It may be due to a disorder of the adrenal cortex as in Addison's disease or primary adrenal insufficiency.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Severe symptoms; hospitalization indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by signs and symptoms that resemble Cushing's disease or syndrome: buffalo hump obesity, striations, adiposity, hypertension, diabetes, and osteoporosis, usually due to exogenous corticosteroids.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Severe symptoms, medical intervention or hospitalization indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by unusually late sexual maturity.

grades.2: No breast development by age 13 yrs for females; testes volume of <3 cc or no Tanner Stage 2 development by age 14.5 yrs for males
grades.3: No breast development by age 14 yrs for females; no increase in testes volume or no Tanner Stage 2 by age 16 yrs for males; hormone replacement indicated

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in production of parathyroid hormone by the parathyroid glands. This results in hypercalcemia (abnormally high levels of calcium in the blood).

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by excessive levels of thyroid hormone in the body. Common causes include an overactive thyroid gland or thyroid hormone overdose.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; thyroid suppression therapy indicated; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe symptoms; hospitalization indicated; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in production of sex hormones from the gonads.

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in production of parathyroid hormone by the parathyroid glands.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Severe symptoms; medical intervention or hospitalization indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation and cellular infiltration of the pituitary gland.

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in production of hormones from the pituitary gland.
notes: Consider Endocrine disorders: Hypophysitis.

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in production of thyroid hormone by the thyroid gland.
notes: Consider Endocrine disorders: Hypophysitis.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; thyroid replacement initiated; increase in current thyroid replacement therapy; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe symptoms; hospitalization indicated; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by unusually early development of secondary sexual features; the onset of sexual maturation begins usually before age 8 for girls and before age 9 for boys.

grades.1: Physical signs of puberty with no biochemical markers for females <8 years and males <9 years
grades.2: Physical signs and biochemical markers of puberty for females <8 years and males <9 years

definition: A disorder characterized by low testosterone.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; mild symptoms with no intervention indicated
grades.2: Replacement therapy initiated

definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation or destruction of the thyroid gland.

grades.1: Asymptomatic
grades.2: Medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Hospitalization indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by inappropriate masculinization occurring in a female or prepubertal male.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by visual perception of unclear or fuzzy images.
notes: Consider: Eye disorders: Uveitis.

grades.1: Intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by partial or complete opacity of the crystalline lens of one or both eyes. This results in a decrease in visual acuity and eventual blindness if untreated.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); glare symptoms affecting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by an area of epithelial tissue loss on the surface of the cornea. It is associated with inflammatory cells in the cornea and anterior chamber.

grades.3: Corneal ulcer without perforation in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by an inability to see clearly in dim light.

grades.1: Symptomatic but not limiting ADL
grades.2: Moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by dryness of the cornea and conjunctiva.
notes: If corneal ulcer is present, grade under Eye disorders: Corneal ulcer. If related to syndromes not present in CTCAE (ex. Sjogren's syndrome, etc.), report as Other, specify in the most representative SOC.

grades.1: Clinical or diagnostic observations only; symptoms relieved by lubricants
grades.2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)
grades.3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by incomplete paralysis of an extraocular muscle.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only
grades.2: Unilateral paresis without double vision
grades.3: Bilateral paresis or unilateral paresis causing double vision in peripheral gaze, but not in central gaze
grades.4: Bilateral paresis requiring head turning to see beyond central 60 degrees or double vision in central gaze

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated; no change in vision
grades.2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately sight-threatening; decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.4: Sight-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated; best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the eye.
notes: Record final diagnosis/cause once determined.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by impaired eyelid function.

grades.1: Clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; nonoperative intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Operative intervention indicated requiring hospitalization; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by a sudden or brief burst of light.
notes: Consider Eye disorders: Retinal tear, Retinal detachment.

grades.1: Symptomatic
grades.2: Limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by an individual seeing spots before their eyes. The spots are shadows of opaque cell fragments in the vitreous humor or lens.
notes: Consider Eye disorders: Retinal tear, Retinal detachment.

grades.1: Symptomatic
grades.2: Limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in pressure in the eyeball due to obstruction of the aqueous humor outflow.

grades.1: Less than 8 mmHg of elevated intraocular pressure (EIOP); no visual field deficit

definition: A disorder characterized by metabolic abnormalities that result from a spontaneous or therapy-related cytolysis of tumor cells. Clinical tumor lysis syndrome (CTLS) requires one or more clinical manifestations along with criteria for laboratory tumor lysis syndrome (LTLS). LTLS is defined by two or more of the following laboratory abnormalities within 3 days before or 7 days after the initiation of chemotherapy: Uric acid ≥ 476 mcmol/L or 25% increase from baseline, Potassium ≥ 6.0 mmol/L or 25% increase from baseline, Phosphorous ≥ 2.1 mmol/L (children), ≥1.45 mmol/L (adults) or 25% increase from baseline, Calcium ≤ 1.75 mmol/L or 25% decrease from baseline.

grades.1: Laboratory tumor lysis syndrome (LTLS) AND creatinine >ULN - 1.5 × ULN
grades.2: LTLS AND creatinine >1.5 – 3.0 × ULN; cardiac arrhythmia managed medically; one brief generalized seizure; seizure(s) well controlled by anticonvulsants; infrequent focal motor seizures not limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: LTLS AND creatinine >3.0 – 6.0 × ULN; cardiac arrhythmia controlled with device (e.g. defibrillator); seizure in which consciousness is altered; poorly controlled seizure disorder; breakthrough generalized seizures despite medical intervention
grades.4: LTLS AND creatinine >6.0 x ULN; life-threatening cardiac arrhythmia or seizure

grades.2: Symptomatic (e.g., dyspnea, cough); medical intervention indicated (e.g., chest physiotherapy, suctioning); bronchoscopic suctioning
grades.3: Supplemental oxygen indicated; hospitalization or elective operative intervention indicated (e.g., stent, laser)
grades.4: Life-threatening respiratory or hemodynamic compromise; intubation or urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by an abnormal communication between the bronchus and another organ or anatomic site.

grades.1: Asymptomatic
grades.2: Symptomatic, invasive intervention not indicated
grades.3: Invasive intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by blockage of a bronchus passage, most often by bronchial secretions and exudates.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic (e.g., mild wheezing); endoscopic evaluation indicated; radiographic evidence of atelectasis/lobar collapse; medical management indicated (e.g., steroids, bronchodilators)
grades.3: Shortness of breath with stridor; endoscopic intervention indicated (e.g., laser, stent placement)
grades.4: Life-threatening respiratory or hemodynamic compromise; intubation or urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a narrowing of the bronchial tube.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic (e.g., rhonchi or wheezing) but without respiratory distress; medical intervention indicated (e.g., steroids, bronchodilators)
grades.3: Shortness of breath with stridor; endoscopic intervention indicated (e.g., laser, stent placement)
grades.4: Life-threatening respiratory or hemodynamic compromise; intubation or urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by an abnormal communication between a bronchus and the pleural cavity.

grades.1: Asymptomatic
grades.2: Symptomatic, invasive intervention not indicated
grades.3: Hospitalization; invasive intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by bleeding from the bronchial wall and/or lung parenchyma.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; invasive intervention not indicated
grades.3: Hospitalization
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; intubation or urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a sudden contraction of the smooth muscles of the bronchial wall or narrowing of the airway. May be manifested as wheezing.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Supplemental oxygen indicated; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.4: Life-threatening respiratory or hemodynamic compromise; intubation or urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by milky pleural effusion (abnormal collection of fluid) resulting from accumulation of lymph fluid in the pleural cavity.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated (e.g., fat-restricted diet); thoracentesis or tube drainage indicated
grades.3: Severe symptoms; elective operative intervention indicated
grades.4: Life-threatening respiratory or hemodynamic compromise; intubation or urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by sudden, often repetitive, spasmodic contraction of the thoracic cavity, resulting in violent release of air from the lungs and usually accompanied by a distinctive sound.
notes: Record final diagnosis/cause once determined.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; nonprescription intervention indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms, medical intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe symptoms; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by an uncomfortable sensation of difficulty breathing.
notes: Consider Cardiac disorders: Heart failure; Record final diagnosis/cause once determined.

grades.1: Shortness of breath with moderate exertion
grades.2: Shortness of breath with minimal exertion; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Shortness of breath at rest; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by bleeding from the nose.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated (e.g., nasal packing, cauterization; topical vasoconstrictors)
grades.3: Transfusion; invasive intervention indicated (e.g., hemostasis of bleeding site)

definition: A disorder characterized by repeated gulp sounds that result from an involuntary opening and closing of the glottis. This is attributed to a spasm of the diaphragm.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe symptoms; interfering with sleep; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by harsh and raspy voice arising from or spreading to the larynx.

grades.1: Mild or intermittent voice change; fully understandable; self-resolves
grades.2: Moderate or persistent voice changes; may require occasional repetition but understandable on telephone; medical evaluation indicated
grades.3: Severe voice changes including predominantly whispered speech

definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in the level of oxygen in the body.
notes: Consider Respiratory, thoracic and mediastinal disorders: Dyspnea, Pneumonitis; Record final diagnosis/cause once determined.

grades.1: Asymptomatic decrease in oxygen saturation <LLN
grades.2: Decreased oxygen saturation with exercise (e.g., pulse oximeter <88%); intermittent supplemental oxygen
grades.3: Decreased oxygen saturation at rest (e.g., pulse oximeter <88% or PaO2 <=55 mmHg); continuous supplemental oxygen
grades.4: Life-threatening airway compromise; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., tracheotomy or intubation)

definition: A disorder characterized by swelling due to an excessive accumulation of fluid in the larynx.
notes: Record final diagnosis/cause once determined.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated (e.g., dexamethasone, epinephrine, antihistamines)
grades.3: Stridor; respiratory distress; hospitalization indicated
grades.4: Life-threatening airway compromise; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., tracheotomy or intubation)

definition: A disorder characterized by an abnormal communication between the larynx and another organ or anatomic site.

grades.1: Asymptomatic
grades.2: Symptomatic, invasive intervention not indicated
grades.3: Invasive intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by bleeding from the larynx.

grades.1: Mild cough or trace hemoptysis; laryngoscopic findings
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; intervention indicated
grades.3: Hospitalization
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., tracheotomy or intubation)

definition: A disorder characterized by an inflammation involving the larynx.

grades.1: Mild sore throat; raspy voice
grades.2: Moderate sore throat; analgesics indicated
grades.3: Severe throat pain; endoscopic intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by ulceration or inflammation involving the mucous membrane of the larynx.

grades.1: Endoscopic findings only; mild discomfort with normal intake
grades.2: Moderate pain, analgesics indicated; altered oral intake; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe pain; severely altered eating/swallowing; medical intervention indicated
grades.4: Life-threatening airway compromise; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., tracheotomy or intubation)

definition: A disorder characterized by blockage of the laryngeal airway.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic (e.g., noisy airway breathing), no respiratory distress; medical intervention indicated (e.g., steroids); limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Stridor; endoscopic intervention indicated (e.g., stent, laser); limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by a narrowing of the laryngeal airway.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic (e.g., noisy airway breathing), no respiratory distress; medical intervention indicated (e.g., steroids); limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Stridor; endoscopic intervention indicated (e.g., stent, laser); limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by an uncomfortable persistent sensation in the area of the laryngopharynx.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; no anxiety; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; mild anxiety, but no dyspnea; short duration of observation and/or anxiolytic indicated; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe symptoms; dyspnea and swallowing difficulty; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by paroxysmal spasmodic muscular contraction of the vocal cords.

grades.2: Transient episode; intervention not indicated
grades.3: Recurrent episodes; noninvasive intervention indicated (e.g., breathing technique, pressure point massage)
grades.4: Persistent or severe episodes associated with syncope; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., fiberoptic laryngoscopy, intubation, botox injection)

definition: A disorder characterized by bleeding from the mediastinum.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated; radiologic evidence only
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; intervention indicated
grades.3: Hospitalization

definition: A disorder characterized by obstruction of the nasal passage due to mucosal edema.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
grades.3: Associated with bloody nasal discharge or epistaxis

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the oropharynx or pain on swallowing.
notes: Record final diagnosis/cause once determined.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; altered oral intake; non-narcotics initiated; topical analgesics initiated
grades.3: Severe pain; severely altered eating/swallowing; narcotics initiated; requires parenteral nutrition

definition: A disorder characterized by an abnormal communication between the pharynx and another organ or anatomic site.

grades.1: Asymptomatic
grades.2: Symptomatic, invasive intervention not indicated
grades.3: Invasive intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by bleeding from the pharynx.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; intervention indicated
grades.3: Hospitalization
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; intubation or urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by ulceration or inflammation involving the mucous membrane of the pharynx.

grades.1: Endoscopic findings only; minimal symptoms with normal oral intake; mild pain but analgesics not indicated
grades.2: Moderate pain, analgesics indicated; altered oral intake; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe pain; unable to adequately aliment or hydrate orally; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by a necrotic process occurring in the pharynx.

grades.3: Inability to aliment adequately by GI tract; invasive intervention indicated; tube feeding or TPN indicated
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent operative intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a narrowing of the pharyngeal airway.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic (e.g., noisy airway breathing), no respiratory distress; medical intervention indicated (e.g., steroids); limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Stridor; endoscopic intervention indicated (e.g., stent, laser); limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.4: Life-threatening airway compromise; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., tracheotomy or intubation)

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the pharyngolaryngeal region.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in amounts of fluid within the pleural cavity. Symptoms include shortness of breath, cough and marked chest discomfort.
notes: Record final diagnosis/cause once determined.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; intervention indicated (e.g., diuretics or therapeutic thoracentesis)
grades.3: Symptomatic with respiratory distress and hypoxia; operative intervention including chest tube or pleurodesis indicated
grades.4: Life-threatening respiratory or hemodynamic compromise; intubation or urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by bleeding from the pleural cavity.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; mild hemorrhage confirmed by thoracentesis
grades.2: Symptomatic or associated with pneumothorax; chest tube drainage indicated
grades.3: >1000 ml of blood evacuated; persistent bleeding (150-200 ml/hr for 2 - 4 hr); persistent transfusion indicated; elective operative intervention indicated; hospitalization
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; intubation or urgent intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the pleura.
notes: Record final diagnosis/cause once determined.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation focally or diffusely affecting the lung parenchyma.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe symptoms; oxygen indicated; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.4: Life-threatening respiratory compromise; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., tracheotomy or intubation)

definition: A disorder characterized by abnormal presence of air in the pleural cavity resulting in the collapse of the lung.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic; intervention indicated
grades.3: Sclerosis and/or operative intervention indicated; hospitalization indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by excessive mucous secretion in the back of the nasal cavity or throat, causing sore throat and/or coughing.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by expectorated secretions upon coughing.
notes: Record final diagnosis/cause once determined.

grades.1: Occasional/minimal production of sputum with cough
grades.2: Moderate sputum production; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Persistent or copious production of sputum; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by accumulation of fluid in the lung tissues that causes a disturbance of the gas exchange that may lead to respiratory failure.
notes: Unless there is a clear non-cardiac cause, please record this event as Cardiac disorders: Heart failure. Record final diagnosis/cause once determined.

grades.1: Radiologic findings only; minimal dyspnea on exertion
grades.2: Moderate dyspnea on exertion; medical intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe dyspnea or dyspnea at rest; oxygen indicated; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.4: Life-threatening respiratory compromise; urgent intervention or intubation with ventilatory support indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by the replacement of the lung tissue by connective tissue, leading to progressive dyspnea, respiratory failure or right heart failure.

grades.1: Radiologic pulmonary fibrosis <25% of lung volume associated with hypoxia
grades.2: Evidence of pulmonary hypertension; radiographic pulmonary fibrosis 25 - 50% associated with hypoxia
grades.3: Severe hypoxia; evidence of right-sided heart failure; radiographic pulmonary fibrosis >50 - 75%
grades.4: Life-threatening consequences (e.g., hemodynamic/pulmonary complications); intubation with ventilatory support indicated; radiographic pulmonary fibrosis >75% with severe honeycombing

definition: A disorder characterized by an abnormal communication between the lung and another organ or anatomic site.

grades.1: Asymptomatic
grades.2: Symptomatic, invasive intervention not indicated
grades.3: Invasive intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in pressure within the pulmonary circulation due to lung or heart disorder.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; radiographic, physical, or diagnostic findings
grades.2: Symptomatic; requiring medical intervention
grades.3: Severe symptoms, associated with hypoxia, right heart failure; oxygen indicated
grades.4: Life-threatening airway consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., tracheotomy or intubation)

definition: A disorder characterized by impaired gas exchange by the respiratory system resulting in hypoxia and a decrease in oxygenation of the tissues that may be associated with an increase in arterial levels of carbon dioxide.
notes: Consider Respiratory, thoracic and mediastinal disorders: Pneumonitis.

grades.4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention, intubation, or ventilatory support indicated

term: Respiratory, thoracic and mediastinal disorders - Other, specify

grades.1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated

grades.3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by excessive mucous secretions draining from the nose.

grades.1: Present

grades.3: Stenosis with significant nasal obstruction; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the face, between the eyes, or upper teeth originating from the sinuses.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by cessation of breathing for short periods during sleep.

grades.3: Oxygen desaturation; associated with pulmonary hypertension; medical intervention indicated; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by the involuntary expulsion of air from the nose.

grades.1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by marked discomfort in the throat.

grades.1: Mild pain
grades.2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe pain; limiting ability to swallow; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by a high pitched breathing sound due to laryngeal or upper airway obstruction.

grades.3: Respiratory distress; medical intervention indicated; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.4: Life-threatening airway compromise; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., tracheotomy or intubation)

definition: A disorder characterized by an abnormal communication between the trachea and another organ or anatomic site.

grades.1: Asymptomatic
grades.2: Symptomatic, invasive intervention not indicated
grades.3: Invasive intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by an inflammation or ulceration involving the mucous membrane of the trachea.

grades.1: Endoscopic findings only; minimal hemoptysis, pain, or respiratory symptoms
grades.2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Severe pain; hemorrhage or respiratory symptoms; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by a narrowing of the trachea.

grades.1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
grades.2: Symptomatic (e.g., noisy airway breathing), no respiratory distress; medical intervention indicated (e.g., steroids); limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Stridor or respiratory distress; invasive intervention indicated (e.g., stent, laser); limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.4: Life-threatening airway compromise; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., tracheotomy or intubation)

definition: A disorder characterized by a change in the sound and/or speed of the voice.

grades.1: Mild or intermittent change from normal voice
grades.2: Moderate or persistent change from normal voice; still understandable
grades.3: Severe voice changes including predominantly whispered speech; may require frequent repetition or face-to-face contact for understandability; may require assistive technology

definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in density of hair compared to normal for a given individual at a given age and body location.

grades.1: Hair loss of <50% of normal for that individual that is not obvious from a distance but only on close inspection; a different hair style may be required to cover the hair loss but it does not require a wig or hair piece to camouflage
grades.2: Hair loss of >=50% normal for that individual that is readily apparent to others; a wig or hair piece is necessary if the patient desires to completely camouflage the hair loss; associated with psychosocial impact

definition: A disorder characterized by an abnormal body smell resulting from the growth of bacteria on the body.

grades.1: Mild odor; physician intervention not indicated; self care interventions
grades.2: Pronounced odor; psychosocial impact; patient seeks medical intervention

definition: A disorder characterized by large, red, rounded plaques covered with thicker scales.

grades.1: Present; topical intervention indicated
grades.2: oral intervention indicated
grades.3: IV intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation of the skin characterized by the presence of bullae which are filled with fluid.
notes: If infectious, consider Infections and infestations: Rash pustular or other site-specific Infections and infestations term.

grades.1: Asymptomatic
grades.2: Painful blisters; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Blisters covering >50% BSA; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.4: Blisters covering >75% BSA; associated with fluid or electrolyte abnormalities; ICU care or burn unit indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by flaky and dull skin; the pores are generally fine, the texture is a papery thin texture.

grades.1: No associated erythema or pruritus
grades.2: Associated with erythema or pruritus; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by dry and itchy patches of skin involving the epidermis and superficial dermis and includes some scaling, crusting, or serous oozing.

grades.1: Present; topical intervention indicated
grades.2: Oral intervention indicated
grades.3: IV intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by target lesions (a pink-red ring around a pale center).

grades.1: Not associated with skin tenderness
grades.2: Associated with skin tenderness
grades.3: Associated with oral or genital erosions
grades.4: Associated with fluid or electrolyte abnormalities; ICU care or burn unit indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by generalized inflammatory erythema and exfoliation. The inflammatory process involves >90% of the body surface area.

grades.2: Erythema covering >90% BSA without associated symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Erythema covering >90% BSA with associated symptoms (e.g., pruritus or tenderness); limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.4: Erythema covering >90% BSA with associated fluid or electrolyte abnormalities; ICU care or burn unit indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by diffuse erythema and scaling involving > 90% of the body surface area.

grades.1: Present; topical intervention indicated
grades.2: oral intervention indicated
grades.3: IV intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by change in hair color or loss of normal pigmentation.

grades.1: Present

definition: A disorder characterized by a change in the way the hair feels.

grades.1: Present

definition: A disorder characterized by the presence of excess hair growth in women in anatomic sites where growth is considered to be a secondary male characteristic and under androgen control (beard, moustache, chest, abdomen).

grades.1: In women, increase in length, thickness or density of hair in a male distribution that the patient is able to camouflage by periodic shaving, bleaching, or removal of hair
grades.2: In women, increase in length, thickness or density of hair in a male distribution that requires daily shaving or consistent destructive means of hair removal to camouflage; associated with psychosocial impact

definition: A disorder characterized by excessive sweating.

grades.1: Limited to one site (palms, soles, or axillae); self care interventions
grades.2: Involving >1 site; patient seeks medical intervention; associated with psychosocial impact

definition: A disorder characterized by a thickening of the outer layer of the skin.

grades.1: Present
grades.3: Limiting self-care ADLs or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by hair density or length beyond the accepted limits of normal in a particular body region, for a particular age or race.

grades.1: Increase in length, thickness or density of hair that the patient is either able to camouflage by periodic shaving or removal of hairs or is not concerned enough about the overgrowth to use any form of hair removal
grades.2: Increase in length, thickness or density of hair at least on the usual exposed areas of the body [face (not limited to beard/moustache area) plus/minus arms] that requires frequent shaving or use of destructive means of hair removal to camouflage; associated with psychosocial impact

definition: A disorder characterized by reduced sweating.

grades.2: Symptomatic; limiting instrumental ADL or mild/moderate impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)
grades.3: Increase in body temperature; limiting self-care ADL or severe impact on age-appropriate normal daily activity (pediatric)

definition: A disorder characterized by a symmetric eruption of flat-topped, red or purple papules on the trunk and extremities.

grades.2: oral intervention indicated
grades.3: IV intervention indicated

definition: A disorder characterized by a change in the nails.

grades.1: Present

definition: A disorder characterized by a change in the color of the nail plate.

grades.1: Present

definition: A disorder characterized by loss of all or a portion of the nail.

grades.1: Asymptomatic separation of the nail bed from the nail plate or nail loss

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the skin.

grades.1: Mild pain

definition: A disorder characterized by redness, marked discomfort, swelling, and tingling in the palms of the hands or the soles of the feet. Also known as Hand-Foot Syndrome.

grades.1: Minimal skin changes or dermatitis (e.g., erythema, edema, or hyperkeratosis) without pain

grades.2: Associated with psychosocial impact; mild symptoms
grades.3: Covering >50% BSA; moderate or severe symptoms

definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in sensitivity of the skin to light.

grades.1: Painless erythema
grades.2: Tender erythema

definition: A disorder characterized by an intense itching sensation.

definition: A disorder characterized by the development of nonfollicular, sterile pustules on an erythematous base.

definition: A disorder characterized by the presence of macules (flat) and papules (elevated). Also known as morbilliform rash, it is one of the most common cutaneous adverse events, frequently affecting the upper trunk, spreading centripetally and associated with pruritis.

grades.1: Asymptomatic
grades.2: Mild symptoms
grades.3: Macules/papules covering >50% BSA; moderate or severe symptoms

definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the skin covering the top and the back of the head.
